plugin.name: updater
plugin.author: distantorigin
plugin.description:
Update Plugin - Control the Miriani-Next updater binary
Commands: update switch - Opens the channel switcher interactively update switch <dev|stable> - Switches to specified channel non-interactively update check - Checks for updates without installing update version - Shows the updater version update install - Downloads and installs the updater if not present update help - Shows this help update - With no arguments, checks for and performs an update with restart confirmation if needed

muclient.script:
execute = require("execute") async = require("async")
function OnPluginInstall() AcceleratorTo("ctrl+u", "update_run()", sendto.script) if not check_updater_exists() then Note("The updater is not installed. Automatically installing...") Execute("update install") end end
function check_updater_exists() local homedir = GetInfo(66) local updater_path = homedir .. "update.exe"
local file = io.open(updater_path, "r") if file then file:close() return true end return false end
function download_updater(callback) local homedir = GetInfo(66) local download_url = "https://github.com/distantorigin/next-launcher/releases/latest/download/miriani.exe" local updater_path = homedir .. "update.exe"
Note("Downloading updater...")
-- Use curl to download (handles SNI, redirects, everything properly -- sigh). Windows 10 1803 required. local cmd = 'curl -sL -o "' .. updater_path .. '" "' .. download_url .. '"'
execute.doAsyncExecute(cmd, function(success, output, exit_code, err) if success and exit_code == 0 then -- Verify file exists and has content local file = io.open(updater_path, "rb") if file then local size = file:seek("end") file:close() if size > 0 then Note("Successfully downloaded update.exe (" .. size .. " bytes) to " .. homedir) if callback then callback(true) end return end end Note("Error: Download appeared to succeed but file is empty or missing") if callback then callback(false) end else Note("Error: Failed to download update.exe (curl exit code: " .. tostring(exit_code) .. ")") if output and #output > 0 then for _, line in ipairs(output) do Note(" " .. line) end end if callback then callback(false) end end end, { hide_window = true, working_dir = homedir, timeout = 120 }) end
function get_current_channel() local homedir = GetInfo(66) local channel_file = homedir .. ".update-channel"
local file = io.open(channel_file, "r") if not file then return "stable" end
local channel = file:read("*all") file:close()
channel = channel:match("^%s*(.-)%s*$") return channel or "stable" end
function parse_check_output(output_lines) local info = { update_available = false, restart_required = false, version = nil, channel = nil, changes = 0 }
for _, line in ipairs(output_lines) do if line:match("Update available: Yes") then info.update_available = true elseif line:match("Restart required: Yes") then info.restart_required = true elseif line:match("Version: (.+)") then info.version = line:match("Version: (.+)") elseif line:match("Channel: (.+)") then info.channel = line:match("Channel: (.+)") elseif line:match("Changes: (%d+)") then info.changes = tonumber(line:match("Changes: (%d+)")) end end
return info end
function run_updater_hidden(args, callback) if not check_updater_exists() then Note("Error: update.exe not found. Please run 'update install' to download it.") if callback then callback(false, {}, -1) end return end
local homedir = GetInfo(66) local cmd = homedir .. "update.exe " .. args .. " -non-interactive"
execute.doAsyncExecute(cmd, function(success, output, exit_code, err) if success then if callback then callback(success, output, exit_code) end else if err and err:match("error 740") then Note("Error: Windows requires administrator privileges to run the updater.") Note("To fix this permanently:") Note(" 1. Right-click MUSHclient.exe and select 'Properties'") Note(" 2. Go to the 'Compatibility' tab") Note(" 3. Check 'Run this program as an administrator'") Note(" 4. Click OK and restart MUSHclient") -- Don't call callback - we've already shown the user what to do return else Note("Updater error: " .. (err or "Unknown error")) if callback then callback(false, {}, exit_code or -1) end end end end, { hide_window = true, working_dir = homedir, timeout = 60 }) end
function run_updater_visible(args) if not check_updater_exists() then Note("Error: update.exe not found. Please run 'update install' to download it.") return end
local homedir = GetInfo(66) local cmd = "update.exe" utils.shellexecute(cmd, args, homedir, "open", 1) end
function update_dispatcher(name, line, wildcards)
local args = wildcards[1]
if args then args = args:match("^%s*(.-)%s*$") end
-- Parse the command if not args or args == "" or args == "quietly" then -- No arguments or ran with quietly--run update update_run(args == "quietly") else -- Split args into command and parameters local cmd, params = args:match("^(%S+)%s*(.-)$")
if cmd == "install" then if check_updater_exists() then Note("update.exe already exists. No need to download. If you wish to force the updater to reinstall itself, use 'update reinstall'.") else download_updater(function(success) if success then Note("Installation complete. Running update check and generating manifest...") run_updater_visible("-generate-manifest") DoAfterSpecial(5, "update_run(0)", sendto.script) else Note("Installation failed.") end end) end
elseif cmd == "reinstall" then download_updater(function(success) if success then Note("Reinstallation complete. Running update check...") update_run(0) else Note("Reinstallation failed.") end end)
elseif cmd == "switch" then if params == "" then -- Interactive switch run_updater_visible("switch") elseif params == "dev" or params == "stable" then -- Switch to specific channel run_updater_hidden("switch " .. params, function(success, output, exit_code) if success and #output > 0 then for _, line in ipairs(output) do Note(line) end else Note("Error: Failed to switch channel") end end) else Note("Invalid channel. Use 'dev' or 'stable'.") end
elseif cmd == "check" then run_updater_hidden("check", function(success, output, exit_code) if success and #output > 0 then for _, line in ipairs(output) do Note(line) end else Note("Error: Failed to check for updates") end end)
elseif cmd == "version" or cmd == "-v" then run_updater_hidden("-version", function(success, output, exit_code) if success and #output > 0 then for _, line in ipairs(output) do Note(line) end else Note("Error: Failed to get updater version") end end)
elseif cmd == "help" or cmd == "-h" or cmd == "--help" then Note(GetPluginInfo(GetPluginID(), 3))
else Note("Invalid command. Type 'update help' for usage.") end end end
-- Main update function (with restart check) function update_run(quiet) if not quiet then Note("Checking for updates...") end
-- First, check if updates are available (hidden, no console flash!) run_updater_hidden("check", function(success, output, exit_code) if not success or not output or #output == 0 then Note("Error: Failed to check for updates") return end
local info = parse_check_output(output)
if not info.update_available then if not quiet then BroadcastPlugin(999, "") Note("Already up to date!") end return end
BroadcastPlugin(888, info.version)
Note("Updating to version "..info.version)
-- Get the current channel local channel = get_current_channel()
local response if not quiet then -- Build the message local message = "A new update is available on the " .. channel .. " channel! Would you like to install it now?"
if info.restart_required then message = message .. "\n\nNote: This update requires MUSHclient to be restarted." end
-- Build the title local title = "Update Available" if info.version then title = "Update to Version " .. info.version end
-- Ask user for confirmation response = utils.msgbox(message, title, "yesno", "?", 1) else response = "yes" end
if response == "yes" then if not quiet then Note("Starting update...") end
-- Run the update if info.restart_required then run_updater_visible("-allow-restart -non-interactive") else run_updater_visible("-non-interactive") end else if not quiet then Note("Update cancelled.") end end end) end
